title: Senator Flake: I Will Vote to Confirm Kavanaugh
content:
President Trump , who was on Air Force One en route to a rally in Kansas while the Senate voted on Judge Kavanaugh , invited reporters aboard the flight to watch the vote in his office in the front of the plane .
After Vice President Mike Pence announced that Judge Kavanaugh had been confirmed , the president flashed reporters a thumbs up as aides applauded . “ Great decision , ” Mr. Trump said . He said Judge Kavanaugh would “ go down as a totally brilliant Supreme Court justice for many years , ” adding that he had chosen the judge for his “ temperament , his incredible past , his outstanding years on the court . ”
Mr. Trump added that he was “ honored ” Judge Kavanaugh had been able to “ withstand ” the allegations of sexual assault against him , which the president called a “ horrible , horrible attack by the Democrats . ”
Asked about women angry about the outcome of the vote , Mr. Trump said : “ I don ’ t think they are. ” He said women were “ outraged at what happened to ” Judge Kavanaugh and that they were “ in many ways stronger than the men in his favor . ”
The president said women were “ extremely happy ” that Judge Kavanaugh had been able to move past the allegations against him “ because they ’ re thinking of their sons , they ’ re thinking of their husbands and their brothers , their uncles , and others . ”
Mr. Trump said he was “ 100 % ” certain that the allegations against the new Supreme Court justice were not true , saying the FBI had done an “ excellent job ” -- and that if they were true , “ that would have come out loud and clear ” in the past decades he has spent as a judge .
President Trump called Judge Kavanaugh following the Senate vote to congratulate him , the White House said . Mr. Trump , who signed the judge ’ s commission aboard Air Force One on his way to the rally , also spoke to Vice President Mike Pence , Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and House Speaker Paul Ryan .
Also while aboard the flight , the president in a tweet taunted a crowd of protesters in front of the Supreme Court . “ The crowd in front of the U.S. Supreme Court is tiny , looks like about 200 people ( & most are onlookers ) - that wouldn ’ t even fill the first couple of rows of our Kansas Rally , or any of our Rallies for that matter ! ” Mr. Trump wrote . “ The Fake News Media tries to make it look sooo big , & it ’ s not ! ”
Hundreds of people protested on Saturday , with police arresting 150 on the steps of the Capitol and another 13 who chanted during the vote.In the last two weeks Capitol Police have arrested hundreds of demonstrators , some 300 alone on Thursday when Senators had the chance to review the FBI report on the sexual misconduct allegations against Judge Kavanaugh , and another 100 on Friday .
content_original:
President Trump, who was on Air Force One en route to a rally in Kansas while the Senate voted on Judge Kavanaugh, invited reporters aboard the flight to watch the vote in his office in the front of the plane.

After Vice President Mike Pence announced that Judge Kavanaugh had been confirmed, the president flashed reporters a thumbs up as aides applauded. “Great decision,” Mr. Trump said. He said Judge Kavanaugh would “go down as a totally brilliant Supreme Court justice for many years,” adding that he had chosen the judge for his “temperament, his incredible past, his outstanding years on the court.”

Mr. Trump added that he was “honored” Judge Kavanaugh had been able to “withstand” the allegations of sexual assault against him, which the president called a “horrible, horrible attack by the Democrats.”

Asked about women angry about the outcome of the vote, Mr. Trump said: “I don’t think they are.” He said women were “outraged at what happened to” Judge Kavanaugh and that they were “in many ways stronger than the men in his favor.”

The president said women were “extremely happy” that Judge Kavanaugh had been able to move past the allegations against him “because they’re thinking of their sons, they’re thinking of their husbands and their brothers, their uncles, and others.”

Mr. Trump said he was “100%” certain that the allegations against the new Supreme Court justice were not true, saying the FBI had done an “excellent job” -- and that if they were true, “that would have come out loud and clear” in the past decades he has spent as a judge.

President Trump called Judge Kavanaugh following the Senate vote to congratulate him, the White House said. Mr. Trump, who signed the judge’s commission aboard Air Force One on his way to the rally, also spoke to Vice President Mike Pence, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and House Speaker Paul Ryan.

Also while aboard the flight, the president in a tweet taunted a crowd of protesters in front of the Supreme Court. “The crowd in front of the U.S. Supreme Court is tiny, looks like about 200 people (& most are onlookers) - that wouldn’t even fill the first couple of rows of our Kansas Rally, or any of our Rallies for that matter!” Mr. Trump wrote. “The Fake News Media tries to make it look sooo big, & it’s not!”

Hundreds of people protested on Saturday, with police arresting 150 on the steps of the Capitol and another 13 who chanted during the vote.In the last two weeks Capitol Police have arrested hundreds of demonstrators, some 300 alone on Thursday when Senators had the chance to review the FBI report on the sexual misconduct allegations against Judge Kavanaugh, and another 100 on Friday.
